storyInfo: The void eats away at everyone's emotions. Arturia uses the sound of her strings to connect everyone and inspires them to fight. Empress Grimmacht sacrifices herself and stays behind in Kargereich to keep the demons away from Leithanien.

attributes.content: The Elafia sits with her legs crossed, her back against a desk. She places a pillow on her knees and spreads open a book upon it, the candlelight illuminating her drooping head.
The girl reads in undisturbed silence.
Then she raises her head from the page to meet Viviana's gaze.
You don't seem very surprised to see me, Vivian.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...I saw your shadow in the doorway, and knew it was you.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Ja. You've spent so long observing the shadows in this tiny room, lit only by candlelight.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What are you reading?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: 'The Last Knight.'
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: I'm currently at the—
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Third-to-last chapter. Behind the nameless knight is a huge and lonely lighthouse. The relentless waves push him and his steed Rocinante back.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But they roar as one, and towards the huge waves, as dark as night...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They charge.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Eek! No spoilers please.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: You'll spend a night reading that paragraph over and over again, until you fall asleep on the floor with the pillow in your arms. Until Mutti returned in the middle of the night to blow out the candles.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Huh? How do you know?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Of course she knows—the room, the posture, the book...
This is her memory, after all.
Viviana retreats into the doorway.
Are you leaving?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Vivian.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I have questions about my life, and I need to look for the answers.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Maybe, just maybe, there's still time to open one last door.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: How many have you opened already?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: More than a hundred? I've already lost count.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I just want to... find a better possibility.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Oh. And what if you still can't find one?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Is 'better' something clearly defined, like a math problem?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: In those doors you've entered, maybe Mutti and Vati got to live in peace together for longer, without anyone disturbing them, or maybe Mutti left us a few years later than she did.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: If you think about it, how do you know you haven't already come across a 'better' answer?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: So why do you still carry so much regret?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: How can you be sure you'll ever find one in the first place?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: And what happens even if you do? It won't change your past. What's meant to happen has already happened.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Vati always said that if he'd waited at Marigold Alley for just ten more minutes, maybe he could have met with Mutti, and everything would have turned out differently.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: 'A pity fate does not afford us a chance to start over.'
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: But even if he did meet her, he'd still have to leave anyway, right? The story wouldn't change in any way, aside from giving Mutti one last chance to cry and say goodbye.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Or maybe you're actually hoping you won't find a better answer? Because then you could tell yourself that this was the best of all possible worlds?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: I just don't get it. Aren't you thinking the same way that Vati did?
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Vivian...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm going back to my book.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: You're disappointed, aren't you?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You should go. There's still time to open the next door.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: The sound of collapse approaches.
Viviana turns around. The line of doors collapsing in succession scores in her eyes, like dominoes toppling into one another, or the fireworks in her memories going off all night long.
The rumbles travel from afar, reaching the tallest spire in Sturmland.
Her father seldom comes here. As the Kurfürst, he has to receive an endless line of visitors on festival nights, and her maid mother will be busy serving them until the early hours of the morning.
She would huddle in the corner of a room, just like now, and shield the sounds outside with books.

attributes.text: 'Once the waves washed away, once glory and life together faded.'
'The world and all its beings fell from zenith to nadir, becoming dust.'
'Once the forge belched its flames, once Catastrophe descended, once families and old friends alike forsook the soul.'
'The last knight upon this great land, all alone, faced the swells as dark as night and began to charge.'
Back then, she had yearned for this so much, so full of courage.
She had told herself not to be weak, to imagine herself as a knight—Viviana the Knight.
A true knight is unafraid of disaster or hardship.

attributes.content: The 'collapse' is clearly visible, its ruin right before her eyes.
An inexpressible sense of danger strikes Viviana in her heart. She suddenly feels a strong premonition that the collapsing doors are not simply a manifestation of her repeated failures.
If this tiny room were to be swallowed up, something truly would be wiped away. Something would be lost, forever.
Viviana.
When the knight charged toward the endless waves, did you imagine that he was trying to overcome the entire world?
No.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I won't leave.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana turns around, protecting the little girl with her own body.
I don't even know what's really been going on, ever since I began climbing that spiral staircase.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Maybe this is something everyone goes through when they come to the Genesis Horn. To be tightly bound by the knots deep in their hearts; to lose themselves in a whirlpool of chaos, becoming one with it.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Vivian, what do I say to you? Or rather, what do I say to myself?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The light of a candle is dim, and its flame will always flicker at the whims of the night wind. There will always be filth coming at you and regrets you can't revoke. The bafflement of finding and grief of losing will seek to swamp you over.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But you must believe. The stories you once yearned for are not at all legends or symbols.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You've seen for yourself a radiance that can light up the entire land. A light that does not flicker, even when no one is walking the path it illuminates.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Maybe you yourself are not that radiant light. But you, too, have once drawn your blade to protect it.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Never forget this, Viviana Droste: you are a knight!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The collapse arrives, and darkness swallows her in an instant.
Compared to the Last Knight, whose nemesis was the ocean beneath and the sky above him, she knows nothing about her enemy's identity.
She suddenly finds herself unable to feel the sword in her hand, nor can she light a candle. Fear, suffocating as the ocean and raging as a tide, instantly scours her to the point of numbness.
But soon she feels calmed, soothed, and relaxed somehow. Dread and sorrow no longer drown her.
Because bit by bit, the waves are no more.
Just what is it, in those collapsed doors and their cracks, that is devouring her emotions?!
Countless images, real and fake, intertwine, binding Viviana into a strange yet soft cocoon. What must she hold onto? What CAN she hold onto?
A dazzling light fills up her vision. She comes to a stark realization—
Tested by a dark, bitter, and thorny path, and scored in history by its legend... A knight swordstaff that even time itself can never wear away—
Here and now, it shines in the palm of her hand.
She tightens her grip with the weapon in her hand. The knight now wields her swordstaff and cleaves at the darkness ahead.
Its radiance intensifies, and a resplendent gold builds all, delivering its radiance toward the ends of time and space.
Gone are the spiral staircase and the doors.
Viviana looks down at her empty hands, betraying the gritty sensation that felt so real just now. She shuts her eyes, reconstructing in her mind the last thing she had seen within the darkness—
Malevolent spirits take the form of indescribable sounds, lights, shapes, and colors, together forming chaos itself. Piercing through it all was the swordstaff, resplendent and glorious.
I was holding onto... a projection of it.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Their Majesties...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No! More terrifying calamities in the chaos outside the Genesis Horn would befall... This place must not fall to ruin!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Fremont?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The twins failed... Yet you have come to conclude my concert at the end.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You have been a recapitulation in my ascension and downfall.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Leave. The Pavillon is disintegrating.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Hah. Or are you here for your phylactery?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Your achievement in Kargereich would be enough to earn the respect and fear of the people, yet your attitude remains as loathsome as ever.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Should I be grateful that you 'milked it for all it's worth'?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I've never seen you so reluctant, Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: But I must have it back. It will have a role to play in Kazdel's survival.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I've dragged this on for far too long. So many years have come and gone. The Lich King's Court should have left Leithanien ages ago.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: 'Exile'?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You had the chance to perform this witchcraft long ago, in that secret room in Ludwigs-Universität.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: How long has it been, as they count time outside?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: A hundred and thirty years or so.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: In the next moment, the belated witchcraft crosses both the protracted span of time and the divergent paths of its companions to be cast once more.

Heavy, grizzled rain falls upwards. Kargereich seems to be flipped over by this stream of flow, and the Exile, which is taking his full effort to perform, is soft and permeated with an unusual beauty.
You have never made yourself a greater fool, Fremont.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Phylacteries are a knot you Liches tie inside the veil, one that resonates with your life. It is impossible for you to not feel its presence.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Raindrops cluster into strings, dancing in the void to the rhythm of Fremont's breathing.
His breaths are nothing unusual, but a long-lost abundance of emotions wells up from the depths of his soul.
Fremont casually touches his pocket, only to discover that his lost key has been lying quietly there, within reach all along.
Did I not already return it to you, long ago?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Fremont, the phylactery is a constant, a keystone upon which Liches accumulate their time.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You are always one step ahead of death. I am not.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: A fact you refuse to acknowledge. Why?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The moment the entire space is soaked, the Lich's strings finally envelop the Witch King. Embracing, entangling, almost forming a coffin-like shape.
You have no words for me but farewells at this moment. Tell me, Fremont, my dearest friend.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Why is this spire still lacking...?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The age-indifferent Lich merely stands before the empty space, without a hint of expression on his face.
The traces of the Exile scatter, and the threads feel not the Witch King's presence, as if the ferocious Caprinae with the twisted horns had never existed in the first place.
Only his final murmur remains in the air.
As weighty as an interrogation, as light as a sigh.
She does not know when it happened, but Arturia finds herself standing before the spire.
She listens in a daze. There is no one able to answer her question, and the sighs are silenced.
So those were your parting words. And... your 'answer.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Henceforth, Leithanien will never again have a Witch King.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So this is where you were, Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico looks up and sees the gigantic black spire gradually lose its shape and color before his eyes, as its faded Originium clusters dissipate into vestiges.
Even the Witch King, known far and wide as history's most powerful soul, was unable to resist his inevitable demise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Freeze.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico lifts his gun.
Leithanien's Twin Empresses have already intervened directly, and the overall impact of this case has far exceeded the initial risk assessment of the mission.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Once this has concluded, I will contact Pope Yvangelista XI as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Until then, your freedom will be restricted until we can return to Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico has heard her answer.
The distant relative he knows all too well does not engage in her usual meaningless push-and-pull of emotional logic and kinship. She simply refuses wearily and walks towards him.
You can pull the trigger now, Federico.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Right this very moment, in the chaos known as Kargereich, you're the only one before my eyes, and there is no one I can perform for.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I've lost my music. I won't run, and I can't play any games either.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: There are holes in your logic, Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia walks straight past him, as if she did not hear him at all.
The Genesis Spire... is disintegrating.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn is dead, so naturally the bubble he was bracing will also burst.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Is he really no longer here?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You don't believe your own eyes? Even after dropping that attitude of yours not so long ago?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: ...So in the end, Grimmacht and Ewigegnade were still the only ones who could kill him.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Wonderful, you only sound mildly disappointed this time. One day you'll look back on today and realize with even more clarity just how fortunate you were to turn away from the fate that lay before you.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Something dangles down from Fremont's robe.
Suddenly, Ebenholz realizes Fremont's shadow has remained in pace, even as the man himself just stepped closer.
The shadow wraps around the crumbling throne, stretching all the way along the steps before gradually coiling around the entire spire.
Your shadow...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My shadow...? Hah! Don't let your eyes deceive you.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: What you see are my threads, my destiny... the essence of my being.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: You are the second Leithanian besides Herkunftshorn to perceive my true form.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Are you using your lifethreads to hold up the collapsing space?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But aren't they more important than flesh and blood to you Liches?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn did a lot of disgraceful things, but he was right about one thing.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Annihilation is almost upon us. If we let Kargereich leak out and deep fry Leithanien into a cavity of nothingness, we'll all be gone, Lich or not.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: So run, little lamb.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: This place can't hold the living for much longer. Leave this tomb quickly, lest death catches up to you.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Shadows crawl all over the old Lich's body.
Shades of black instantly split into countless threads.
They fly towards every falling piece of debris and crack in the void.
But the vibrations still intensify.
It's too late.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The collapse is... right before us.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Can it... rain in this space too?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Ah, these are Herr Fremont's threads. He's always kept himself so neat and tidy, unlike other Liches. I've never seen him grow so many threads.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The Genesis Horn can no longer support this place.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We need to return to reality before this place falls completely apart.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Then we'll need to find a way out first.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: A brilliant ray of Arts?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Empresses' Voice Viviana Droste. I should have fought alongside Your Majesties. Please forgive me for my tardiness.
...It's you.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Viviana, your light is somewhat brighter than before.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: That's because... I saw true darkness.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I was just walking along an endless spiral staircase, witnessing the collapse of one possible reality after another... and was almost swallowed by the chaos.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: After that, at some point, I caught a glimpse into the darkness, and...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I haven't the slightest idea what I saw.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Perhaps it was the deepest of dreads, the largest of voids, complete disarray, and... a calamity we cannot comprehend.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They lay dormant within the chaos, and I felt their gaze upon me.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Grimmacht, Ewigegnade—
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The enemy is advancing like a blitz. They are about to invade everything known to us.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I can't feel the thread anymore?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Oh, no no no—the threads are all vibrating together! They're so intense I can't make out the one connected to the Genesis Horn!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Lessing... Lessing!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: (Unprecedented noise)
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: Frau Ermengarde, Herr Maeyer is over here!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: He shouldn't have...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I'm... not dead yet.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Phew. My threads are a mess, so it's hard to sense you even at this distance.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: And the professor... we were still connected earlier.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The other Liches and I were pulling on reality from our side, while he was doing the same to the Genesis Horn from his end. It wasn't easy, but we managed to achieve a balance!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But things are looking bad now, it's all gone wrong.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: They're... no longer making any noise.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Nein, it's not just the dead.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The music... it stopped.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The... the Witch King... the Twin Empresses...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Sturm... land... Ma... Martha...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: The whole theater has fallen silent.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Every piece of music... every sound has vanished.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It is as if someone had used the largest-scale silencing Arts ever cast.
Those who lost control of themselves in the chaotic noise have now lost their surface-level agitation.
Pain, anger, and other intense emotions fade from their faces, replaced by a deep fear.
But this dread does not last for long; instead, it expands into a blank space, and at its peak, a void.
Something seeps out of the void.
Something that's eroding and annihilating everything.
Order collapses. Chaos wishes to tarry, but cannot.
The calamity within the void, the vacuum that corrodes all of existence.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Its eyes have noticed us.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: No wonder our threads couldn't stabilize the space on both sides...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: ...What's coming for us?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: *sigh* It sure would be nice if our enemies were tangible.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The scariest part is that they might not even appear.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Kargereich gets its name from its emptiness. It's just a void. So place with nothing at all, conversely invading our reality... What do you think will happen?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We need to get the old man and the others out, right away. Then figure out a way to block the passage.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Ermengarde, can you and the old man still hear each other?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...We're cutting it close. In all this mess, I'll need time to find the end of the right thread connecting our two sides. But they'll never get out without it!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Did they... fail? Grimmacht... failed? That's impossible...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Get back here. Think, fool, think... about what's concerning you most.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Grim... Grimmacht... I can't...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: She should have given you a final order.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: If she doesn't come back...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: If... time runs out, and the Gesatzswächter don't receive a new.. a new order.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I see, their last resort will be to annihilate Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: For once, I agree with her choice. It's one thing if we all die here, but we mustn't let Leithanien... and everyone else outside the country, die with us.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Wait, the knot moved just now. The people inside haven't given up. Let's hold on, just a bit longer!
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Ermengarde, does this knot count as a 'thread' between the two sides?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It'll have to. I'm trying my best, and if the connection stabilizes, the professor and I might be able to focus on the Arts cast on the knot to stabilize the passage.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We're counting on you, Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I can feel Lessing and the others...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They're close!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And you think that's a good thing?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Kargereich and reality are once again drawing near, like two bubbles stacked on top of one another. No, more like a bubble balanced on the tip of a needle. Even the slightest bit closer, and the bubble will burst.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: So if I pull on the knot and move further away... will you and Ermengarde be able to stabilize the passage?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Stay away from the edge of the bubble!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Scheiße, little lamb. You're going to get yourself caught in the void.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The knot trembles in his hand.
Ebenholz can feel the hand gripping the other end.
A hand already numb from too much time spent swinging a sword.
His strength, spent. His Arts, nearly exhausted. His wounds no longer bleed, and his pain gradually blurs.
His duty and his will remain seated deep within his brain, pulsing tenaciously. Such concepts are difficult to describe after language itself has collapsed.
Why did we come here? Why have we been fighting? Why were we born, and why will we die?
The void greets him. There is no path either forward or out, only nothingness to meet.
Ebenholz is falling.
And at the end of his fall... there will be nothing at all.
No. There is something there.
A warm shade of white, emitting a radiant yet gentle glow.
Ebenholz suddenly realizes that while he didn't have time to find the cello-playing Sankta, he has found the answer.
The emotions and memories he shared with him were not bestowed upon them by any person, Arts, or even fate itself.
The most beautiful part, right there with him, has always belonged only to them.
A smile.
A piece of music.
A touch... of hope.
Fate will always be snatching things away from us, but fortunately I still retain the ability to love and hate.
Zwillingstürme's glowing sunset, ardent marigolds in bloom, a child with eyes glistening like a lake, and her gentle parents...
I love the scenery and the people I cannot see. They illuminate me, dispelling the darkness obscuring the eyes of many others.
But I also hate it.
I hate how brief the flowering season is, and the formless wills constricting everything I love. My child, your brows have been knitted ever since you returned to Leithanien.
You asked me: 'Where is the new order? Can you guarantee it will be better than yesterday or today?'
There is no way I can answer you, so I just decide to do as I have.
Love means responsibility, and hate will likewise attract even more. You must take responsibility for the things you have changed, and have yet to change.
My child, my friend, if you love, if you hate, then you will bear far more than you can imagine.
I doubt.
Is doubt a form of cowardice? Or bravery?
If cowardice, then why did I mix the flesh and blood of those monsters into our sacramental bread and wine, willing to place my hopes in a different faith?
If bravery, then why did I retract my hand? Did the vivid and hideous living tissues frighten me at the very last moment?
For sixty years I could not see that elusive Paradise, while my life fell apart before my eyes. I do not want to pray, but it is all I can do.
Who wrote the laws, and who ensures their purity and integrity? I ask my faith, and it stays silent.
I dare not say that I've already rid myself of the delusions embedded in the depths of my mind. No, I still harbor doubts.
The monastery gets further and further away, and I find a handful of seeds in the folds of my robe. Oh, Clément, my son, I will find them a patch of moist soil, even if I were to die on the road.
I doubt our laws. Question my cowardice, suspect my bravery, and doubt pushes me on forward.
Honestly, I hate alcohol. But suddenly I found myself unable to live without it. It's been a long time since Yulia's death. Three years? Five?
Twice in my life I have run away.

The so-called holy city of Laterano is not as perfect as it seems. The sweetness and noise in the air mask the inequality beneath, the differences between Liberi and Sankta seemingly not worth discussing.
I was still young when I came to Leithanien. The dark clouds I saw were a stark contrast to the white walls of Laterano. Countless died tragically under the Witch King's regime.
I was the first soldier to set foot in the Witch King's Spire, but I never once believed that his defeat would usher in a new era for Leithanien.
Yulia was wrong. I've always been pessimistic. Disappointment makes me sober, disappointment compels me to look for a few good things to protect.
But in the end, I reached a compromise with my disappointment, and ended up like this.
If souls truly have a final destination, then I most probably won't be going to the same place as her.
But surely I've protected at least a few people, at the very end? I want to ask Herr Executor, Yulia, and myself...
Do I still count as a hero?
I seem to be walking along a sandy shore.
A sticky beach. A strange creature from the ocean actually reverberated in my strings.
It has the dullest inner voice I've ever heard, and I couldn't obtain any answers. The waves push me away from the beach.
I was twenty then.
I seem to be walking over sand dunes.
Soft grains of sand. Opposite me is a warrior known as the Zhayedan, as old as the golden grains.
With every note I play, history roars from the cracks in the warrior's armor.
I was fifteen then.
I seem to be walking on grass.
Out on a lawn in the rain. I'm attending my first funeral.

attributes.text: 'My thanks to Arturia. It was her music that helped free me of my fetters.'
'And my thanks to you, Marcello. Thank you for blessing me with a wonderful life all these years. I doubt we'll be apart for long.'
'Once this war is over, we'll be together again.'

attributes.content: I stand before the gravestone, watching guests walk up, one by one, to pay their respects to my mother.
I hear their voices clearly—sorrow, lament, regret, ridicule, hatred, glee... but why, and how, were they still able to maintain the most suitable sadness on their faces?
Do we not respect life only by facing death with our truest feelings?!

I remember what you told me, Mamma. I can still hear your voice from time to time. How much courage do I need, to be able to struggle free from my ego day after day? To be brave enough to make that first step?
Freedom is so hard to find.
But death... why is death so easy?!
I had finished my performance by the time I awoke.
Fede. Once again, I couldn't control my own music.
Hm?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Arturia, you revere death so much.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Death erases one's existence so easily, and puts all emotions to rest.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The melodies of those who faced the truth and, inevitably, their deaths leave you impressed, but more often they leave you fearing, hating, doubting. But you—you are silent.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How much more do you need to perform as you wander endlessly about? How long before you finally reach that future? How many more blank pieces do you need to compose for yourself?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Even silence will be played, and every composition must have its conclusion.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I saw your only truth.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You are so, so fragile.
Arturia opens her eyes.
She seems to have walked for a long time. Time is like a river, and people travel along with the flow. But why is she, step by step, trudging back the way she came?
She feels she has become a broken vessel. And the unwavering affection, intense hatred, tremendous courage, and unreconcilable despair and remorse she has experienced through thousands of people...
They drain from her, drop by drop... until she is left with only her empty self.
She finds herself outside Kargereich, in a plaza surrounded by a crowd. Emotionless faces walk past her, and she stands there in a daze mirroring the same expression as everyone else.
Arturia looks up, lifting her head from the lawn she never left.
Dark clouds drift over her, and a glistening drop of rain falls on her face, like a tear—
—A tear for the grief and vulnerability she could not admit in time.
Martha, my love, you were the one who lifted me up from my darkest days, inspiring me.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: But now I can only live with thoughts of you.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Should I go looking for you? Even if our fathers disagree, you must at least know that my love for you has never wavered, not in the slightest.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Martha... my love, you were the one who lifted me up from my darkest days, inspiring me to do whatever I wanted...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: But now I can only live with thoughts of you.
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: I should go looking for you. Even if our fathers disagree, you must at least know that my love for you...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Every person in the huge amphitheater before the Spires is muttering something on repeat. They speak of their feelings, but their words lack even a hint of emotion.
They do not see Arturia, or anyone else.
A triangle hits her arm as people cross paths with one another, and she almost drops her own instrument.
Grimmacht... Grimmacht...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Michael.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Don't leave me alone...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: It's futile, Federico.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Good call.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The situation is out of control.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Mass hallucination... this is the third time I've seen something like this, but the situation here is much more serious than it was at Sonata Spire.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's of a different nature.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The Genesis Horn has crumbled after the Witch King's demise, and Kargereich is about to collapse into reality.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's not a simple hallucination either, but rather... They are unable to resist the onslaught of chaos, and their various, profound emotions are leaving them.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What you're hearing from them now is the only emotion they have left, and their most intense.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What are you doing, Arturia?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Güldenesgesatz, the law, morality, exemplary aesthetics... Order cannot help them resist the all-pervasive chaos.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Everyone in the plaza will turn into an empty shell of themselves, one by one, as they lose their very last scrap of emotion.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We need to bring them back to their senses.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You alone are special here, Federico.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: For most, how can there be will without emotion?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Only with emotions and emotions alone can people preserve their ego.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: These people are 'blank' as you say, and you still plan to play their tunes?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No. This time, my performance is about me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's about my own emotions, and I'll share them with everyone here.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This sounds like another form of empathy.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Yet you've tried many times to destroy the foundations of Laterano's empathy. You turned your back on Laterano long ago.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Turned my back on Laterano? Maybe I didn't care... but never once have I left Laterano of my own will.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I just strongly disagreed with the order represented by their law.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: As for empathy... Its limits are actually the starting point of my vision for the future.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I'll explain in more detail later, but for now, look at the countless people before us.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They used to cry with all their might, to smile with enthusiasm, and even now are trying their utmost to retain the very last bit of emotion they experienced in their lives, right up until the final moment... Even if they can no longer realize it themselves.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Be it the Witch King or Yulia, everyone is equally great and praiseworthy, but also equally incomplete and fragile. This is our ego, the very essence of our humanity.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We must become strong, but we must also leave room for our ineradicable fragility.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This is why we need a future where we can all stand side by side, sharing our joys and sorrows.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I am perceiving myself, Federico.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: At this very moment, I can only give hope to others if I harbor hope myself, and likewise with love.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I want to use this tiny shred of ego to connect every sorrow and joy.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The sound of your strings... people are coming your way...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That young noble's face is showing an expression.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Emotional reflux, an involuntary reaction. A hollowed out soul needs time to re-accept everything.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Operation assessment: Arturia, your actions will help stabilize the situation. Executor Federico Giallo will assist you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I will allow no one to interrupt you until you have finished playing.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: After the briefest of pauses, Arturia grips her bow tightly again. The movement builds towards its climax, the scrubbed strings resounding in a rapid flutter like a butterfly's wings.
She manages a glance up at the sky, and sees a giant crack suspended above the twin spires—an eye of darkness open wide, but still the sunset surrounds it, yet to be completely eroded.
How beautiful the sunset is, like a blaze set aflame when the shackles are smashed open.
...That sound. The Sankta's performing.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The knot's moving again, I can sense Ebenholz! Ermengarde—!
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: On it, on it.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Threads fly into the clouds from the Lich's fluttering robes.
The wind traverses the sky again, and the frozen clouds resume their drifting.
A mildly intense vibration follows right after, like the slight turbulence when a train enters a station.
The passage is stable.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: As long as you stay awake, they'll be out in no time.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Michael, wake up!
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Grimmacht must have entrusted you with something. You need to recall what it was!
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: My... tuba...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Hold your instrument properly.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: ...Grimmacht?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Is this... my memory? The strings are showing me...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The tuba's heavy, and you're tired. Correct?
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: Then say it. You're but a child. There's no need to hide what's in your heart.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: You're afraid? That's normal.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: Adults fear me, as do nobles older than yourself. Even the most ferocious casters fear me. They believe my sword will pierce through their chests the moment it crosses my mind to.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: ...Yet you're unafraid? And you want to be my Voice?
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: Have you really thought this through? No, that doesn't matter. You're just a child, after all, who knew nothing when your kin sent you here.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: Don't... don't cling to my leg. I can't wield my sword if you're like this. Fine, I'll just assume you're tired.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: You'll have to practice your instrument and Arts later, in your own room. There are nobles waiting outside to see me, so I won't be coming back here today.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: You can take a nap... or play for a while.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: If you still want to be an Empresses' Voice, we can discuss it again when you're able to carry a tuba. Also, don't think that you have to become one just because that's what Lupukarn expects of you.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: We cannot choose where we are born, but we should at least be able to choose when to turn around. Our responsibilities should not be forced on us by others.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: You'll have the right to play the horn I gave you when you've thought it through on your own, and decided on what you want to stand here as.
attributes.name: 'Grimmacht'

attributes.content: Mm, I remember now. I have to play my tuba. I have to tell the Gesatzswächter everyone's safe.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I won't disappoint you.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Meine Majestät... Grimmacht.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: ...Fine work, Michael.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The cello... it sounds so clear. Is Frau Giallo helping us? No, not just us... she's helping everyone.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: At the very least, we still have our souls for the moment.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: We can still fight.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Is that... the outside? Is this a passage? We can exit through it!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana, find Fremont and ensure that everyone in this space returns to Terra.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: What about you and Grimmacht?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Us?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Naturally, we'll fulfill the duty we've always shouldered...
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: To keep any and all threats away from Leithanien.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Finally. Just the two of us now.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The final melody... has already resounded.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Lieselotte, your shield will cover the twin towers and everyone under the spires.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: And your sword...
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: My fate has long since been decided, from the moment I stepped into this place.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: No, from even before that.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Once the Genesis Horn broke away from the plans Fremont and I had drafted for it, and descended upon the center of Zwillingstürme, there was only one choice left to me.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: ...Indeed.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Hildegard, is there... nothing else you want to ask me?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Well, sure enough, your response is pretty much what I expected.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The passage is closing rapidly.
Darkness rushes in, filling up the tiny cracks that should not exist.
Wrapped in the dark fog are countless restless eyes, swarming towards the two of them and the reality behind them.
A shade of gold brushes past a hue of black.
Herkunftshorn built a spire here, establishing order amidst chaos.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: As one who's inherited his power and even killed him, naturally I'll be able to surpass him in this as well.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The eyes in the void, the threats within the chaos, the beings condensed from fear, the enemies who do not exist in reality—
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: 'Demons.'
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: I, Grimmacht, Kaiserin of Leithanien, and her sharpest sword—
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: —Hereby declare that you will never invade my country.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: A radiant blaze blossoms from Grimmacht's sword.
The fragments of the Genesis Spire scattered in the void reunite under the command of her Arts, erecting a new 'spire.'
The monument stands between Kargereich and reality, blocking the eyes in the dark from prying on all living existence.
The twin spires in reality, the people beneath them, and the clouds above all blend into one under her light, becoming a blurry warm ripple, gradually drifting away from her.
Grimmacht does not look back.
Her Arts, her sword, and her body have all become one with the pitch-black monument.
They all say you are impossible to defeat.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Be it here and now, or in the distant future, I will be undone by chaos before joining it.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: This is my fate.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: But it is absolutely not... the fate of Leithanien and her people.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The... sunset?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: It's back...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: And... so beautiful...
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Did something fall from the sky?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The irregular dark clouds crack open.
A clearly visible hue of gold shines through the grim sky, gracefully caressing everyone's faces with its light.
Leithanien's people wake up from their dystopian nightmare and are immediately greeted by dazzling clouds of rosy gold descending between the twin spires.
No one knows who started it, but the people involuntarily begin to play the instruments in their hands.
It is no longer the Güldenesgesatz, or any other familiar classical piece.
A brand new melody accompanying the multicolored radiance of Originium Arts echoes the excitement in everyone's hearts, flowing spontaneously under the rosy clouds.
Did you see that, Federico?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Leithanien's new hero... No, the birth of a new god.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The one who killed Herkunftshorn for the second time, neutralized Leithanien's calamity, and brought hope and vitality back to the people of this great land. Leithanien's sole Kaiserin, Ewigegnade, the Eternal Grace.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: She will replace the Genesis Spire completely and become the sovereign of Leithanien's skies, more splendid than the gold of the sunset itself... Gold der Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The people are ecstatic, and her wish is fulfilled.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But this newborn god... she sheds a tear.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The brilliance of her golden radiance snatches away everyone's attention, leaving the tear rolling off her face to remain in darkness for eternity.
attributes.name: Arturia
